intro: Caesalpinia laxiflora, commonly known as the silky serissa, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and distinctive, showy flowers. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, often resembling a ball or a head. Its seeds are enclosed in long, slender pods that split open when mature. Caesalpinia laxiflora is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
